Uses of Interface
org.jruyi.io.ICodec

  • Packages that use ICodec 
    Package Description
    org.jruyi.io
    JRuyi IO Package Version 1.1

    • Uses of ICodec in org.jruyi.io

      Classes in org.jruyi.io that implement ICodec 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AbstractCodec<T>
      A default ICodec implementation with all methods throwing UnsupportedOperationException.

      Methods in org.jruyi.io with parameters of type ICodec 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <T> T IBuffer.get(int index, ICodec<T> codec)
      Uses the specified codec to decode the bytes starting at the specified index from the underlying buffer into an object of type T and returns the resultant object.
      <T> T IBuffer.get(int index, int length, ICodec<T> codec)
      Uses the specified codec to decode the bytes, starting at the specified index and ending at (index + length), from the underlying buffer into an object of type T and returns the resultant object.
      <T> void IBuffer.get(int index, T dst, ICodec<T> codec)
      Uses the specified codec to decode the bytes starting at the specified index from the underlying buffer into the specified dst.
      <T> void IBuffer.get(int index, T dst, int offset, int length, ICodec<T> codec)
      Uses the specified codec to decode the bytes starting at the specified index from the underlying buffer into the specified dst starting at the specified offset and ending at (offset + length).
      <T> IBuffer IBuffer.prepend(T src, ICodec<T> codec)
      Writes the bytes, encoded from the specified object src with the specified codec, to the head of this buffer.
      <T> IBuffer IBuffer.prepend(T src, int offset, int length, ICodec<T> codec)
      Writes the bytes, encoded from the specified collection src with the specified codec starting at offset ending at (offset + length), to the head of this buffer.
      <T> T IBuffer.read(ICodec<T> codec)
      Uses the specified codec to decode the bytes starting at position from the underlying buffer into an object of type T and returns the resultant object.
      <T> T IBuffer.read(int length, ICodec<T> codec)
      Uses the specified codec to decode the bytes, starting at position and ending at (position() + length), from the underlying buffer into an object of type T and returns the resultant object.
      <T> int IBuffer.read(T dst, ICodec<T> codec)
      Uses the specified codec to decode the bytes, starting at position, from the underlying buffer into the specified dst and returns the actual number of bytes decoded.
      <T> int IBuffer.read(T dst, int offset, int length, ICodec<T> codec)
      Uses the specified codec to decode the bytes, starting at position, from the underlying buffer into the specified dst starting from offset(inclusive) to (offset + length)(exclusive) and returns the actual number of bytes decoded.
      <T> IBuffer IBuffer.set(int index, T src, ICodec<T> codec)
      Sets the bytes starting at the specified index to the ones encoded from the specified src of type T with the specified codec.
      <T> IBuffer IBuffer.set(int index, T src, int offset, int length, ICodec<T> codec)
      Sets the bytes starting at the specified index to the ones encoded from the specified collection src, starting at the specified offset, ending at (offset + length) with the specified codec.
      <T> IBuffer IBuffer.write(T src, ICodec<T> codec)
      Writes the bytes, decoded from the specified object src with the specified codec, to the end of this buffer.
      <T> IBuffer IBuffer.write(T src, int offset, int length, ICodec<T> codec)
      Writes the bytes, decoded from the specified collection src starting at the specified offset ending at the specified (offset + length) with the specified codec, to the end of this buffer.
